content:
• Thursday, September 20, 2012
  • KYAK

    Kayak (KYAK +2.7%) rallied today after CEO Steve Hafner declared on CNBC (video) that Google...

    Kayak (KYAK +2.7%) rallied today after CEO Steve Hafner declared on CNBC (video) that Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) isn't a threat to the travel search engine. "Google has had their flight search and hotel finder out in the market for two years ... it's an inferior product," Hafner asserts. Kayak and Google have a complex relationship: about a tenth of Kayak's traffic comes from Google queries, and the company relies on data from Google's ITA Software unit. Kayak opposed Google's purchase of ITA last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • TIBX

    Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) guides on its FQ3 earnings call (webcast) for FQ4 revenue of $310M-$318M and...

    Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) guides on its FQ3 earnings call (webcast) for FQ4 revenue of $310M-$318M and EPS of $0.42-$0.44, below a consensus of $326.7M and $0.47. Shares -4.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • PEIX

    Pacific Ethanol (NASDAQ:PEIX) -25.9% AH after announcing a public offering of common stock and...

    Pacific Ethanol (NASDAQ:PEIX) -25.9% AH after announcing a public offering of common stock and warrants; the size and prices are not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • WMC

    Western Asset Mortgage (NYSE:WMC) declares an $0.85/share Q3 dividend vs. $0.57 in Q2 (Q2...

    Western Asset Mortgage (NYSE:WMC) declares an $0.85/share Q3 dividend vs. $0.57 in Q2 (Q2 dividend was actually $0.38, but following its IPO, covered just half the quarter). In light of new Fed policy - "(which) may have a significant impact on the valuation of our portfolio" - the company issues guidance on its book value, believing it to be $22.68 on Sept. 14. "We continue to be pleased with the position of our portfolio." Shares +9.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • WMC

    Western Asset Mortgage Capital (NYSE:WMC) declares $0.85/share quarterly dividend. For...

    Western Asset Mortgage Capital (NYSE:WMC) declares $0.85/share quarterly dividend. For shareholders of record Oct 01. Payable Oct 25. Ex-div date Sep 27. Shares +8.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • PGNX

    Progenics Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PGNX) announces a company-wide restructuring , including a...

    Progenics Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PGNX) announces a company-wide restructuring , including a reduction of its workforce by 26%, to 77 employees, and the termination of several early stage research projects. The company will continue to focus on its oncology programs, adding that clinical development and manufacturing capabilities will also be unaffected. In additon, CFO Robert McKinney and SVP of Quality Benedict Osorio will be stepping down, effective September 30. Shares -1.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • TIBX

    Tibco Software (NASDAQ:TIBX): FQ3 EPS of $0.27 in-line. Revenue of $255M (+11% Y/Y) misses by...

    Tibco Software (NASDAQ:TIBX): FQ3 EPS of $0.27 in-line. Revenue of $255M (+11% Y/Y) misses by $4.8M. Shares -4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe (ADBE +4.2%) finishes the day higher after delivering an FQ3 report that featured soft...

    Adobe (ADBE +4.2%) finishes the day higher after delivering an FQ3 report that featured soft guidance but encouraging Creative Cloud data. RBC helped matters by upgrading Adobe to Outperform, albeit while admitting FY13 EPS will suffer from the migration to subscriptions from up-front license fees. During its earnings call, Adobe noted it has 300K free users of Creative Cloud to go with 200K paid subs, and said it's prepping versions aimed at teams and large enterprises.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ACAD

    Acadia Pharmaceuticals (ACAD +13.2%) pushes to a new 52-week high today on the back of a Seeking...

    Acadia Pharmaceuticals (ACAD +13.2%) pushes to a new 52-week high today on the back of a Seeking Alpha article touting the potential of it's experimental anti-psychotic drug pimavanserin. On September 5, ACAD announced the completion of patient enrollment in a phase III study of the drug for treating Parkinson's disease psychosis. If approved, it will be the first antipsychotic drug to receive such approval, and will likely be immediately embraced, and extensively prescribed.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • LPRI

    Lone Pine Resources (LPR +18.2%) shares are surging on no apparent news. Early in the week, LPR...

    Lone Pine Resources (LPR +18.2%) shares are surging on no apparent news. Early in the week, LPR announced it was reviewing its asset portfolio to identify options to reduce debt, improve liquidity and boost the value of its assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRZO

    Carrizo Oil & Gas (CRZO -1.6%) slides on a downgrade to Neutral at Capital One, citing the...

    Carrizo Oil & Gas (CRZO -1.6%) slides on a downgrade to Neutral at Capital One, citing the company's longer than expected North Sea sale. The firm also lowered its price target slightly to $32 from $34.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • NSC

    Norfolk Southern (NSC -8.5%) shares are blasted by the rail operator's pre-announcement of weak...

    Norfolk Southern (NSC -8.5%) shares are blasted by the rail operator's pre-announcement of weak Q3 earnings, but BMO's Fadi Chamoun looks to buy on weakness: "The fundamentals underpinning the merchandise and intermodal segments remain positive. Also, utility coal has bottomed and could recover starting in 2013 assuming normal weather patterns."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • MTEM

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD -5.4%) succumbs to profit taking, after bouncing back strong...

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD -5.4%) succumbs to profit taking, after bouncing back strong from Monday's selloff over poor clinical trial results for its hypoxia-targeted drug TH-302. Separately, Maxim initiated coverage on the stock today with a Buy, saying that TH-302 is currently in a phase III trial as a first-line treatment with doxorubicin for advanced soft tissue sarcoma as well, and there's a good chance for a significant improvement in overall survival.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +1.6%) workers rejected the company's pay offer made yesterday and threaten to...

    Petrobras (PBR +1.6%) workers rejected the company's pay offer made yesterday and threaten to stage a strike Sept. 26 if their demands aren't met. The oil workers union is holding a series of members' assemblies throughout Brazil to determine if they will move forward with its threat; the result of the assemblies should be known Monday.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • XOM

    ExxonMobil's (XOM +0.9%) deal to acquire Denbury's (DNR +3%) Bakken assets creates a buzz around...

    ExxonMobil's (XOM +0.9%) deal to acquire Denbury's (DNR +3%) Bakken assets creates a buzz around firms with assets in the Williston Basin. Wunderlich notes XOM paid top dollar, and it sees potential for XOM to expand in the area or for other majors to move in. Kodiak's (NYSE:KOG) plentiful Williston assets could be worth $13-$15/share based on today's deal; Whiting's (NYSE:WLL) could be worth $70/share.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • WMT

    Shares of Wal-Mart (WMT +0.5%) don't miss a beat after the company announces that it's pulling...

    Shares of Wal-Mart (WMT +0.5%) don't miss a beat after the company announces that it's pulling Amazon Kindles from its stores. Though some idle chatter focuses on Wal-Mart developing its own tablet designed by the wizards at @Walmart Labs, a more likely guess is that the promising testing of a mini-Apple store inside a Wal-Mart location in Arkansas has the retailer thinking of rolling out a broader Apple plan.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • AEZS

    Shares of Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +13.2%) pop after being initiated with a Buy at Roth Capital...

    Shares of Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +13.2%) pop after being initiated with a Buy at Roth Capital with a price target of $1.75, more than double its current valuation. Roth cites optimism over its endometrial cancer candidate, AEZS-108, which plans to begin Phase III testing before the end of the year, the potential for its AEZS-130, an Adult Growth Hormone Deficiency diagnostic that the company is preparing for a New Drug Application.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • AUO

    AU Optronics (AUO -4%) has been fined $500M for its role in a 5-year LCD price-fixing...

    AU Optronics (AUO -4%) has been fined $500M for its role in a 5-year LCD price-fixing conspiracy, half of what the DOJ was seeking. Shares spiked higher on the news, but still remain off on the day. Rival LG Display (LPL -1.9%) is also trading lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • E

    Eni (E -1.8%) says an adverse arbitration decision in a natural gas dispute with GasTerra will...

    Eni (E -1.8%) says an adverse arbitration decision in a natural gas dispute with GasTerra will reduce its Q3 earnings by €604M ($785M). The ruling will allow Eni to claim a price reduction for the gas volumes purchased in the period subsequent to that settled by the decision.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • SWKS

    Skyworks' (SWKS -17.3%) losses have accelerated following its analyst day (webcast), even as...

    Skyworks' (SWKS -17.3%) losses have accelerated following its analyst day (webcast), even as some attendees defend the company. Comments about FQ1 being up "modestly" due to poor demand from low-end (Chinese?) customers are likely affecting shares - the Street is forecasting an 8% Q/Q revenue jump. Also, rumors are floating Skyworks' iPhone 5 chip content could disappoint, though Piper isn't buying them. iPhone 5 teardowns should arrive tomorrow. TQNT -4%. RFMD -3.7%. AVGO -4.1%. (FQ4 guidance)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • X

    U.S. Steel (X -4%) will face more intense completion on slowing Chinese demand and more margin...

    U.S. Steel (X -4%) will face more intense completion on slowing Chinese demand and more margin pressure, Nomura says in cutting shares to Neutral from Buy and slashing its price target to $20 from $32. U.S. Steel's "earnings power is most eroded in a world of lower raw materials prices given its captive iron ore and self-sufficient coke [coal] position." AKS -4.8%, MT -2%, NUE -0.6%, STLD -0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • INFO

    IHS (IHS -18.6%) is having a very ugly day after missing FQ3 estimates and offering weak...

    IHS (IHS -18.6%) is having a very ugly day after missing FQ3 estimates and offering weak guidance. The research/information services provider now expects FY12 revenue of $1.515B-$1.535B and EPS of $3.77-$3.89, below a consensus of $1.57B and $3.98. The disappointing performance is blamed on poor non-subscription sales, which in turn are attributed to customers delaying capital decisions. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • FFI

    Shares of Fortune Industries (FFI +66.6%) ramp higher on heavy volume after it restructures it's...

    Shares of Fortune Industries (FFI +66.6%) ramp higher on heavy volume after it restructures it's merger agreement with Ide Management Group. The amended agreement will result in the company remaining registered with the SEC and continue to be publicly traded. Current shareholders of the company will continue to own their company shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • SUN

    Susser Petroleum Partners (SUSP) equity units are up 22% in their trading debut, earlier rising...

    Susser Petroleum Partners (SUSP) equity units are up 22% in their trading debut, earlier rising to the day's high of $23.78 before settling back. The limited partnership, formed by Susser Holdings to distribute motor fuels, priced its 9.5M common unit IPO at $20.50 last night, raising $195M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • CIE

    Negative results from Cobalt Energy's (CIE +2.1%) drill-stem test of its Cameia #2 appraisal...

    Negative results from Cobalt Energy's (CIE +2.1%) drill-stem test of its Cameia #2 appraisal well could place further pressure on the stock, Stifel Nicolaus believes, and such weakness would create an attractive risk/reward ratio in light of CIE's upcoming catalysts. The firm maintains its Buy rating on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • JCP

    The roller coaster ride for shares of J.C. Penney (JCP -10.6%) continues with the focus of...

    The roller coaster ride for shares of J.C. Penney (JCP -10.6%) continues with the focus of investors after yesterday's shops preview in Dallas lasering in on just how bad H2 results might come in. For the most part, analysts think the retailer is on to something with its broad vision to change retailing, but after alienating core customers and losing out on the back-to-school season the growing pains continue.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 4 Comments
  • IPGP

    IPG Photonics (IPGP -3.5%) slumps after receiving a downgrade to Hold from Noble Financial. The...

    IPG Photonics (IPGP -3.5%) slumps after receiving a downgrade to Hold from Noble Financial. The industrial laser vendor, stung last year by concerns about slowing European and Chinese demand, has rallied strongly this summer.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • MM

    Millennial Media (MM +4.8%) and Yelp (YELP +3.2%) are among the day's tech standouts. Trulia's...

    Millennial Media (MM +4.8%) and Yelp (YELP +3.2%) are among the day's tech standouts. Trulia's strong IPO could have something to do with the moves, given each company's mobile app/ad exposure. Millennial's rally comes just 5 days before its IPO lockup ends.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • BHC

    Stephens gives a boost to a couple medical instrument stocks today, initiating Synergetics...

    Stephens gives a boost to a couple medical instrument stocks today, initiating Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG +15.6%) and Uroplasty (UPI +5.6%) both with Overweight ratings (I, II). OTCQB:SURG designs microsurgical instruments primarily for ophthalmology and neurosurgery markets, while UPI is a medical device company that develops, manufactures and markets products for the treatment of voiding dysfunctions.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • LIVE

    Shares of LiveDeal (NASDAQ:LIVE) race 19.5% higher on volume 6X normal trading activity as the...

    Shares of LiveDeal (NASDAQ:LIVE) race 19.5% higher on volume 6X normal trading activity as the social media player tries to land on the radar of more investors. The name of the game for the company is adding subscribers, and to that end it recently hired Skype veteran Perry Teevens to develop the business.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • FCX

    Indonesia wants metal mining companies including local units of Freeport McMoRan (FCX -2.1%) and...

    Indonesia wants metal mining companies including local units of Freeport McMoRan (FCX -2.1%) and Vale (VALE -1.1%) to raise royalties to 10% as part of negotiations to extend mining contracts. FCX now pays 1% royalty for mining gold and 3.5% for copper; its Grasberg mine in the Papua province accounted for 19% of the parent's revenue last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • NSC

    Shares of Norfolk Southern (NSC -7.7%) take another leg downward after lowering its outlook for...

    Shares of Norfolk Southern (NSC -7.7%) take another leg downward after lowering its outlook for Q3. Economist Robert Dye sees a big difference between the warning put out by FedEx on its earnings and that from Norfolk Southern, noting FedEx's issues are global while Norfolk Southern is U.S-focused.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • PSX

    Oppenheimer raises its price target for Phillips 66 (PSX +1.4%) to $55 from $48 in anticipation...

    Oppenheimer raises its price target for Phillips 66 (PSX +1.4%) to $55 from $48 in anticipation of a large dividend increase at the PSX's first investor meeting next month. PSX already has described plans to use its free cash flow of ~$2B/year to boost its dividend yield above the peer average and reduce its net debt ratio below the average.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • MNK

    More on Questcor (QCOR +8.4%) conference call: COO Steve Cartt says insurance reimbursement for...

    More on Questcor (QCOR +8.4%) conference call: COO Steve Cartt says insurance reimbursement for Acthar was already complicated before Aetna's (NYSE:AET) coverage limitations, but QCOR is experienced in securing coverage for appropriate patients. "We anticipate that insurance coverage for Acthar will continue to be available" for the right patients."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • CLH

    Clean Harbors (CLH -4.5%) is downgraded to Neutral at Robert W. Baird, which sees "near-term...

    Clean Harbors (CLH -4.5%) is downgraded to Neutral at Robert W. Baird, which sees "near-term fundamental and evolving valuation concerns" for the provider of environmental, energy and industrial services. The firm points to flagging rig counts, unfavorable Canadian weather and ongoing equipment transition in expecting risk to CLH's Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • MNK

    Questcor ((QCOR +13.4%)) swings back into the positive today in volatile trade on the back of...

    Questcor ((QCOR +13.4%)) swings back into the positive today in volatile trade on the back of its conference call currently in progress. Some highlights: CEO Don Bailey says it learned of Aetna's new policy only as of Wednesday; Prior authorizations are normal for Acthar, and it should not be used as a primary treatment to begin with; Acthar sales, prescription performance continues to improve. ( Webcast ).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 5 Comments
  • OUTR

    Estimates for Coinstar (CSTR -2.5%) are trimmed at both Piper Jaffray and ITG Research as the...

    Estimates for Coinstar (CSTR -2.5%) are trimmed at both Piper Jaffray and ITG Research as the effect of the Olympics on Q3 results continues to get dissected. Shares have stumbled downward to hit multi-month lows on brisk volume. On tap: Coinstar presents at the Goldman Sachs Communacopia Conference (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • KGC

    Kinross Gold (KGC -1.6%) is upgraded to Buy with a $13.50 price target (up from $9) at TD...

    Kinross Gold (KGC -1.6%) is upgraded to Buy with a $13.50 price target (up from $9) at TD Securities. The firm thinks the worst is behind KGC related to re-setting expectations for the Tasiast project, investors are placing little value on the FDN or Lobo Marte projects, and KGC has a respectable base of existing production. Gold miners' shares are lower today as gold prices dip.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (OVTI -2.6%) and RF Micro Devices (RFMD -3.5%) are two more names selling off in...

    OmniVision (OVTI -2.6%) and RF Micro Devices (RFMD -3.5%) are two more names selling off in response to Skyworks' (SWKS -8.1%) underwhelming FQ4 guidance hike. The fact companies such as OmniVision and Cirrus Logic (Apple suppliers, but not RF chipmakers) are lower following the update suggests some investors are using the news to book profits on the iPhone 5 component trade.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • P

    M&A speculation is always good for a heavily-shorted stock. Pandora (P +2.7%), which had...

    M&A speculation is always good for a heavily-shorted stock. Pandora (P +2.7%), which had 53.8% of its float shorted as of Aug. 31, is rallying following a Bloomberg column suggesting Apple's reported Internet radio plans could lead online music rivals such as Google, Amazon, and Clear Channel to covet Pandora's giant user base and mobile ad business. An Albert Fried analyst thinks Pandora could fetch $20/share. (CEO remarks)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks (SBUX +1.5%) CEO Howard Schultz tells CNBC (video) that customers want its branded...

    Starbucks (SBUX +1.5%) CEO Howard Schultz tells CNBC (video) that customers want its branded coffee from a single cup brewer in a development that adds a bit more pressure to Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -6.3%) to hold onto its market share. As for the "partnership" in place between GMCR and SBUX, Schultz says it's in place for the "time being."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT -6.2%) slides on a downgrade to Sector Perform from Pac Crest....

    GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT -6.2%) slides on a downgrade to Sector Perform from Pac Crest. The LED/solar equipment maker rallied yesterday in response to its Q3 warning, after initially trading lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • CAG

    Shares of ConAgra Foods (CAG +7.7%) race higher after the company records an earning triple play...

    Shares of ConAgra Foods (CAG +7.7%) race higher after the company records an earning triple play by beating on both lines and upping its guidance with management successfully managing a higher food inflation environment via hedges and product innovation. If there is such a thing as a quadruple play, the company achieved that as well by hiking its dividend to an annualized rate of $1.00 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • ASTI

    Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI -26.5%) tumbles to $1.24 after pricing its stock offering, which was...

    Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI -26.5%) tumbles to $1.24 after pricing its stock offering, which was announced yesterday afternoon, at $1.20. Ascent plans to sell 9.2M shares, a figure that translates into a 22% increase in the company's share count.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • Z

    Trulia (TRLA) opened at $22.10 and is now trading at $22.36, 31.6% above an IPO price of $17....

    Trulia (TRLA) opened at $22.10 and is now trading at $22.36, 31.6% above an IPO price of $17. The company now sports a market cap of $591M. Rival Zillow (Z -2.2%), however, is trading lower after announcing the underwriters for a recent stock offering have exercised an option to purchase an additional 420K shares from the company at $43.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • SCMR

    Sycamore (SCMR +7.2%) jumps to $15.77 after its board declares a $10/share special dividend that...

    Sycamore (SCMR +7.2%) jumps to $15.77 after its board declares a $10/share special dividend that will be paid on Oct. 11 to shareholders on record as of Oct. 1. Many have been calling on the optical networking hardware/software vendor to part with a large chunk of its giant cash hoard. Sycamore also says it posted FQ4 (ended in July) revenue of $16.8M, above the $12.9M estimated by the sole analyst who covers it. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 6 Comments
  • NGD

    New Gold (NGD -1.8%) announces a “positive” preliminary economic assessment for its...

    New Gold (NGD -1.8%) announces a “positive” preliminary economic assessment for its Blackwater gold project in British Columbia. Over the first 15 years of its mine life, Blackwater is estimated to produce an annual average of 507K oz. of gold and 2M oz. of silver at total cash costs sold, net of by-product sales, of $536/oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • HZNP

    Horizon Pharma (NASDAQ:HZNP) -24.9% premarket after announcing a public offering of ~21.4M...

    Horizon Pharma (NASDAQ:HZNP) -24.9% premarket after announcing a public offering of ~21.4M units, consisting of common stock and a warrant to purchase a half-share of common stock. The combined price is $3.50/unit. HZNP had 33.8M shares outstanding as of Aug. 7. Net proceeds will be used to fund ongoing commercialization activities for its Duexis and Rayos drugs.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM

  • Market preview: Chinese PMI, eurozone PMI and U.S. weekly jobless claims - they all tell a...

    Market preview: Chinese PMI, eurozone PMI and U.S. weekly jobless claims - they all tell a depressing story and they're all weighing on EU shares and U.S. futures, with the S&P benchmark -0.25%. Back in the corporate world, early earnings results are starting to dribble in, sending ConAgra +6% but Bed Bath -5.7%. Later: Consumer Comfort, Fed Speak, Oracle earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 4 Comments
  • BBBY

    Shares of Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY) slump even lower after coming off of the company's...

    Shares of Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY) slump even lower after coming off of the company's sluggish Q2 report. Nicole Urken sums it up by noting that what should be a housing and holiday play is ending up as a brick-and-mortar laggard. BBBY -6.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) -4.2% after slightly lifting its FQ4 (ends this month) guidance ahead of...

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) -4.2% after slightly lifting its FQ4 (ends this month) guidance ahead of its 2012 analyst day. The RF chipmaker now expects revenue of $420M and EPS of $0.52, compared with prior guidance of $415M-$420M and $0.50-$0.51. Investors were hoping for something better thanks to expectations of strong orders from Apple and Samsung (the result of Skyworks' iPhone 5 and Galaxy S III design wins). TQNT -1.4%. CRUS -2.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • DNR

    Premarket gainers: DNR +9%. UPIP +8%. CAG +6%. CIM +5%. Losers: OTC:ASTI -27%. HZNP -26%. NSC...

    Premarket gainers: DNR +9%. UPIP +8%. CAG +6%. CIM +5%.
    Losers: OTC:ASTI -27%. HZNP -26%. NSC -6%. BBBY -6%. CQP -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • GMCR

    The war of words is on between bulls and bears of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR)...

    The war of words is on between bulls and bears of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) over the impact of a new single-serving coffee machine from Starbucks. Despite assertions to the contrary, the Verismo machine does brew coffee as well as serve as an espresso machine and is priced close to Keurig brewers and Nestle's Nespresso machine. On the flip side, Keurig is clearly the dominant market player and the company has proven itself nimble in the past. GMCR -3.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM | 4 Comments
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources (NYSE:DNR) +9.6% premarket after agreeing to sell its Bakken shale assets in...

    Denbury Resources (NYSE:DNR) +9.6% premarket after agreeing to sell its Bakken shale assets in North Dakota and Montana to ExxonMobil (NYSE:XOM) for $1.6B and XOM's operating interests in Webster Field in Texas and Hartzog Draw Field in Wyoming. The Bakken assets consist of ~196K net acres with expected H2 2012 production of more than 15K boe/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • SPG

    Mall owner Simon Property Group (NYSE:SPG) -2.6% premarket after announcing a public offering by...

    Mall owner Simon Property Group (NYSE:SPG) -2.6% premarket after announcing a public offering by stockholder Melvin Simon Family Enterprises Trust of ~5.9M shares, representing its entire direct ownership stake in SPG and its operating partnership.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • NKE

    Shares of Nike (NYSE:NKE) move up 1.4% premarket following the announcement that the company...

    Shares of Nike (NYSE:NKE) move up 1.4% premarket following the announcement that the company plans to buy back $8B worth of its own stock. Not everyone is a fan of the move however, Jeff Macke notes that's "foolish" to do a huge buyback with shares only $10 off of their highs.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 4 Comments

  • Investors shouldn't get overly excited about the new store layout of J.C. Penney, says Robert...

    Investors shouldn't get overly excited about the new store layout of J.C. Penney, says Robert Baird analyst Erika Maschmeyer. She was one of the 300 analysts/bigwigs brought into a test store in Dallas to see the retailing transformation with their own eyes. Though the crowd that included Bill Ackman walked away with largely positive comments, the buzz is that the "game-changing" shops concept still faces an uphill climb to resonate with Main Street. Shares of JCP -1.4% premarket to $28.70 after taking a wild ride to above $32 late yesterday fueled by some Ron Johnson bravado.

    Just a day after Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) CEO Larry Blanford seemed to scoff at competition from Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX), its rival is out an announcement on its new Verismo single-cup coffee machine. Though Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz says the company is committed to its Green Mountain partnership, analysts still see Verismo as a competitive pressure that could alter the coffee landscape. GMCR -2.6% premarket, SBUX -0.2%.

  • As in Asia, European shares are lower following China's poor PMI data, while concerns about...

    As in Asia, European shares are lower following China's poor PMI data, while concerns about Spain also weigh on sentiment. "Activity in China is still weak and the Europeans are scared to death," a Brussels-based trader says. "The Spanish situation is nerve-wracking but I think Spain's problems are well known." Euro Stoxx 50 -0.65%, London -0.6%, Paris -0.8%, Frankfurt -0.6%, Madrid -0.4%, Milan -0.4%.

  • Asian shares are lower, pulled down by the continued contraction in China's manufacturing...

    Asian shares are lower, pulled down by the continued contraction in China's manufacturing sector, although it's apparently not bad enough to persuade the People's Bank to throw more stimulus at the economy. "Data would probably need to be much worse than this for Beijing to cut interest rates or reserve requirements," says Julius Baer's Alan Lam. Japan -1.6%, Hong Kong -1.1%, China -1.9%, India -0.6%.
